OK so let me get this clear. 
First I configure a job through web interface=
 then click on submit job. 
After that I go to the job directory and edit t=
he seeds file. 
Then I go to the console on the web interface and start cra=
wling.

One more question, if I initiated a new job based on an old one tha=
t has a 
seeds.txt file, is the file going to be copied?

By the way, why t=
here is not anything about this (using seeds.txt) in the 
manual. I think t=
his is very important.

Thanks



________________________________
From: Go=
rdon Mohr <gojomo@...>
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Cc: Muat=
h Alkhalaf <moath2@...>
Sent: Wed, April 20, 2011 2:23:50 PM
Subject:=
 Re: [archive-crawler] How to specify a Seeds file for Heritrix 1.14

Moham=
ed gave the right seeds answer for H3 =E2=80=93 where you edit the 
'crawle=
r-beans.cxml' file for your job, to pull seeds from a different 
place =E2=
=80=93 but the situation is a little different in H1.14.

In Heritrix 1.14,=
 it's assumed there's a 'seeds.txt' file in your job 
directory. You can fi=
nd and edit this file directly on the filesystem 
before you start your cra=
wl. (When it's over a certain manageable size, 
the web UI will no longer s=
how the in-page editable textarea.)

H3 is better at handling millions of s=
eeds, but we've done hundreds of 
thousands of seeds in H1 without problems=
.

Regarding your other questions:

(2)

For postprocessing analysis that p=
ulls together a bunch of related 
resources (such as a text/html page and a=
ll scripts it inlines), you'll 
want to create a master index of what's spr=
ead across your files, then 
use that index to guide you to individual reso=
urces. Our 'Wayback' 
project for browser access does this, as part of its =
operation, so you 
may want to look at it for ideas and code that's applica=
ble to your use.

(3)

There's no master reference; our general recommendat=
ion is to start with 
the bundled defaults and tinker incrementally.

Many =
of the major alternative settings and components are discussed in 
the H1 u=
ser-manual 
(<http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/index.html>) =
or H3 
wiki user-manual 
(<https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritri=
x/Heritrix+3.0+User+Guide>). 
But others are discussed in other wiki pages,=
 or old discussion threads, 
and to find and understand all the lesser-used=
 options requires 
reviewing the Javadoc comments and raw source.

- Gordon=
 @ IA

On 4/20/11 12:14 PM, Muath Alkhalaf wrote:
>
>
> So is this file a g=
lobal configuration file for Heritrix and if so where
> can I find it and w=
hat will happen to the configuration from the web
> interface? Is it going =
to be ignored totally or just the seeds part?
>
> If this is not a global f=
ile but rather a job specific file then again
> where can I find it and whe=
n should I change it? I mean should I first
> submit a job then go and chan=
ge its config file to accept a seeds file?
>
> I am a little bit confused h=
ere.
>
> Thanks
>
> -------------------------------------------------------=
-----------------
> *From:* Mohamed Elsayed <mohammed.elsayyed@...>=

> *To:* archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> *Cc:* Muath <moath2@...>
>=
 *Sent:* Wed, April 20, 2011 12:13:05 AM
> *Subject:* Re: [archive-crawler]=
 How to specify a Seeds file for
> Heritrix 1.14
>
> On 04/20/2011 07:33 AM=
, Muath wrote:
>>
>> Hi,
>> 1- I am wondering if there is a way to specify =
a seeds file for a job
>> instead of filling out the textarea on the web in=
terface. I have a
>> seeds file with 100K URLs but I do not know how to pro=
vide it as input.
>>
> In first you have to comment 2 beans and uncomment o=
nly one bean. The 2
> beans you have to comment them are as follows:
>
> Th=
e first one
> ------------------
>
> <!--<bean id=3D"longerOverrides" 
clas=
s=3D"org.springframework.beans.factory.config.
>
>     <property name=3D"pr=
operties">
>
>       <props>
>
>         <prop key=3D"seeds.textSource.valu=
e">
>
> # URLS HERE
>
>         </prop>
>
>       </props>
>
>     </proper=
ty>
>
>   </bean>  -->
>
> The second one
> ----------------------
>
> <!--=
<bean id=3D"seeds" class=3D"org.archive.modules.seeds.TextSeedModule">
>
> =
          <property name=3D"textSource">
>
>             <bean class=3D"org=
.archive.spring.ConfigString">
>
>               <property name=3D"value">
=
>
>                 <value>
>
> # [see override above]
>
>                 =
</value>
>
>               </property>
>
>             </bean>
>
>         =
  </property>
>
>   <property name=3D'sourceTagSeeds' value=3D'false'/>
>
>=
   </bean>-->
>
> After that you have to uncomment the following bean:
>
> =
  <bean id=3D"seeds" class=3D"org.archive.modules.seeds.TextSeedModule">
>
=
>     <property name=3D"textSource">
>
>       <bean class=3D"org.archive.s=
pring.ConfigFile">
>
>         <property name=3D"path" value=3D"seeds.txt" =
/>
>
>       </bean>
>
>     </property>
>
>     <property name=3D'sourceTa=
gSeeds' value=3D'false'/>
>
>   </bean>
>
> Note that: I put seeds.txt in t=
he same directory of Heritrix. You can
> put it under any directory as you =
want, but you have to write its path
> in the value as shown above.
>
>>
>>=
 2- Here is the scenarion I want to use Heritrix for and I would like
>> to=
 know if my assumptions are correct. I want to gather a data set
>> consist=
ing of webpages that have:
>> a- HTML forms
>> b- Javascript processing for=
ms data.
>> Then I will go offline and iterate over the ARC archive files t=
hat
>> result from my crawl using a java program. While iterating, I can
>>=
 check each one of the files if it is of type html/text and if so check
>> =
if it contains an html form. If it does and the code that processes
>> the =
form is in a separate javascript file is there a way to extract
>> that fil=
e from the archives using for example its URL as an index or
>> do I have t=
o download that file again?
>>
> I can't give you the correct answer.
>>
>>=

>> 3- Is there a good reference with some example profiles with values
>> =
for the different configurations available along with description of
>> whe=
n to use each of these profiles (I mean based on the bandwidth
>> available=
 to my machine and its processing power I can use these
>> reference exampl=
es to better decide different inputs).
>>
> You can look at this URL
> http=
://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/6771. I hope
> it he=
lps you.
>>
>>
>> Thanks for your help
>>
>
>
>
